title.narrative: Advocacy for Equality in Agribusiness by Smallholder’s (SAEASF)

description.narrative: Intense engagement with policy makers in quest to address policies issues and practical problems on land issue and in marketing of rural produce leading to direct negotiations with the Deputy Minister for Local Government. Further, MVIWATA has also participated alongside other partners in monitoring the process for review of the National Land Policy of 1995 to ensure that the policy does not victimise and marginalise smallholder farmers. An analysis of the draft policy was done and the comments given to the Ministry of Lands and shared amongst various partners in relevant platforms. In strengthening institutional growth, the new and revised policy guidelines have helped MVIWATA to improve on its systems namely financial systems, human resources, procurement and general operations. MVIWATA has participated alongside other partners in monitoring the process for review of the National Land Policy of 1995 to ensure that the policy does not victimise and marginalise smallholder farmers. An analysis of the draft policy was done and the comments given to the Ministry of Lands and shared amongst various partners in relevant platforms. Further, the organisation has contributed to increased access of smallholder farmers to financial services through MVIWATA established SACCO .During the reporting period, through MVIWATA established SACCO 241 farmers (male 109, 132 female) accessed loan of Tshs 1,211,384,417 contributing to increased access of farmers to microcredits. In supporting farmers access to markets, 54 groups comprising of 4504 farmers (3,041male, 1,463 female) collectively sold 13,937 tons of maize and rice enabling them to have an income of TZS 13,625,574,200/= . Post-harvest trainings conducted to 783 (male 408, female 375) farmers have resulted with collective aggregation of 28378 tons (15,042 for maize and 13336 for rice) to be sold when the price is at peak.

To improve livelihood of small scale farmers mainly women and youth through increased agricultural productivity and incomes, participartion in leadership and decision making positions and access and ownership to land

participating-org.narrative: Mtandao wa Vikundi vya Wakulima wa Tanzania (Network of Farmer Groups in Tanzania)

activity-date.narrative: Planned end date of the activity
Planned start date of the activity

receiver-org.narrative: Mtandao wa Vikundi vya Wakulima wa Tanzania (Network of Farmer Groups in Tanzania)
